title: When Can OCE Server Transfer be Fixed?
body:
Came back playing last month on NA, wanted to transfer to OCE due to high ping, server message notes that is unavailable till around 8th of November. Now that the notice is being removed and also have another Red Tracker mentioning it should be up, but yet still unable to transfer.

Every restart after transferring, I can log in back to NA with the same amount of RP as if nothing happens, opened a ticket and support team said there seems to be a problem and just straight close my ticket without me being able to reply back.

SO WHEN IT CAN BE FIXED??? If this is what going to happen for a long period of time, i rather just be done with it as a long time player from Season 1.

replies.body: Yeah, my friend tried transferring hes BR account to OCE since he is studying in Australia now and it did the exact same thing as you're experiencing he told me. I hope they fix this soon

I'm still struggling too. I just got my account back after a long hiatus, and playing on 200 ping is painful. I wanna move to OCE from NA, but no matter how many tries, it asks me to restart with the RP clearly still in my account as I can see it there.

Maybe the transactions just declining or something.

Let's hope they give a good discount on transfer when they come out. 

By the looks of it, Transfers to and from OCE will have been down for almost a month or more by the time they are back up.

The server transfers are now completely closed as the season is over. When will they be back up?

Will OCE server transfer work as soon as they're up? God I hope so. I've been waiting days to play this game :(

Transfers are usually down for about 2 weeks at preseason start (so people can't transfer while season rewards are going out). :(

There's been a lot of transfer drama on OCE at the moment, regrettably all we can really do is wait it out and hope that transfers won't be delayed beyond the scheduled downtime this time round.

2 WEEKS. God damn..
I picked the wrong time to try and get back into the game.

Every time you bump a ticket with a new message, you lower it down the priority queue (if I'm not mistaken).

Patience will get things done quicker than going "is it ready yet?", "is it ready yet?", "is it ready yet?", "is it ready yet?", "is it ready yet?", etc.
Support shouldn't be closing your tickets unless you've been spamming them. Just send one ticket, and they should be able to help, or at least tell you why transfers aren't working.
